result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
I received a phone call from Carol Kopp/Jail Admin - stating that she was informed by Mr. Long that he will be waiving his prelim, he would like to appear by video and be sent back to Kettle Moraine. I sent the Clerk of Courts a notice of hearing and asked if phone/video is available for 7/18 at 2:45pm. 
I l/m on vmail informing Atty Spansail of all this information.
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
w/condition Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/ CC - co-defendant and victim SAJ, DME

Court cancels JT on 8/2 & 8/3.  PTC converted to PH.  Court sets bond.  
Deft. needs to be present if PH.  If he waives PH, it can be held by video.
